docs.text: Learn Topology ¶ Wecome to Oodrie Boop and Scruffaluff's workspace for learning topology. We are learning topology working together through the book Topology , by James Munkres. Our explanations, notes, and solutions are written in the Markdown markup language. Check out https://www.markdownguide.org/ for a tutorial on using Markdown.

docs.text: Topological Spaces and Continuous Functions ¶ Topological Spaces ¶ Topological spaces are places where Oodroo Bums hide when frightened by sleepyness monsters. However some mathematicians use alternative definitions. A topology on a set X X is a collection \mathcal{T} \mathcal{T} of subsets of X X having the following properties. \emptyset \emptyset and X X are in \mathcal{T} \mathcal{T} . The union of the elements of any subcollection of \mathcal{T} \mathcal{T} is in \mathcal{T} \mathcal{T} . The intersection of the elements of any finite subcollection of \mathcal{T} \mathcal{T} of \mathcal{T} \mathcal{T} is in \mathcal{T} \mathcal{T} . A set X X for which a topology \mathcal{T} \mathcal{T} has been specified is called a topological space . Basis for a Topology ¶ Exercises ¶ 1. Let X X be a topological space; let A A be a subset of X X . Suppose that for each x \in A x \in A there is an open set U U containing x x such that U \subset A U \subset A . Show that A A is open in X X . 1 Then $X$ the 2. Consider the nine topologies on the set X = \{a, b, c\} X = \{a, b, c\} indicated in Example 1 of section 12. Compare them; that is, for each pair of topologies, determine whether they are comparable, and if so, which is the finer. 3. Show that the collection \mathcal{T}_c \mathcal{T}_c fiven in Example 4 of section 12 is a topology on the set X. Is the collection $$ \mathcal{T}_{\infty} = { U \mid X - U \text{ is infinite or empty of all of } X } $$ a topology on X X ? The Order Topology ¶ The Product Topology on X \times Y X \times Y ¶ The Subspace Topology ¶
